Environment State#

Base class#

class EnvironmentState#
__init__(*args, **kwargs)#

Geometric#

class LineSegment#

A static obstacle of linear shape.

__init__(p1: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]], p2: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • p1 – The first vertex

  • p2 – The second vertex

distance_from_disc(disc: navground.core.Disc, penetration: bool = False) → float#
distance_from_point(point: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]) → float#
property e1#
Type:

numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]

The unit vector along the segment

property e2#
Type:

numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]

The unit vector perpendicular to the segment. Oriented to the left with respect to e1

property length#
Type:

float

The segment length

property p1#
Type:

numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]

The position of the first vertex

property p2#
Type:

numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]

The position of the second vertex

class Disc#

A circular shape. Used to represent obstacles.

__init__(position: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]], radius: float) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • position – The position

  • radius – The radius

property position#
Type:

numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]

The center of the disc in world frame

property radius#
Type:

float

Radius

class Neighbor#

A neighbor agent of circular shape.

__init__(position: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]], radius: float, velocity: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]] = array([0., 0.]), id: int = 0) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • position – The position

  • radius – The radius

  • velocity – The velocity

  • id – The identifier

property id#
Type:

int

An identifier for the id of agents or the individual agent. The interpretation is up to the behavior.

property velocity#
Type:

numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]

The velocity

class GeometricState#
__init__() → None#
property line_obstacles#
Type:

List[navground.core.LineSegment]

The current list of line obstacles. positions are in the world fixed frame.

property neighbors#
Type:

List[navground.core.Neighbor]

The current list of neighbors. positions are in the world fixed frame.

property static_obstacles#
Type:

List[navground.core.Disc]

The current list of static obstacles. positions are in the world fixed frame.

Sensing#

class BufferDescription#

Describes a typed, bounded, multi-dimensional buffer.

Mimics Gymnasium Box spaces (https://gymnasium.farama.org/api/spaces/).

__init__(shape: List[int], dtype: object = 'float', low: float = 2.2250738585072014e-308, high: float = 1.7976931348623157e+308, categorical: bool = False) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • shape – The shape

  • type – The type

  • low – The low

  • high – The high

  • categorical – The categorical

property categorical#
Type:

bool

Whether the [integer] data is categorical or not.

property high#
Type:

float

The upper limits

property low#
Type:

float

The lower limits

property shape#
Type:

tuple

The shape of the buffer

property type#
Type:

dtype

A code that identify the type of data.

class Buffer#

A typed, bounded, multi-dimensional array, similar to numpy arrays.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)#

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(description: navground.core.BufferDescription, value: Union[float, float, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int]) -> None

Constructs a new instance with data set to a uniform value.

Parameters:

  • desc – The description

  • value – The value to assign to all of the buffer.

  1. __init__(description: navground.core.BufferDescription, data: Union[List[float], List[float], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int]]) -> None

Constructs a new instance, with data set to zero.

Parameters:

desc – The description

  1. __init__(description: navground.core.BufferDescription) -> None

Constructs a new instance with data

Parameters:

  • desc – The description

  • value – The data

  1. __init__(data: Union[List[float], List[float], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int]]) -> None

Constructs an unbounded, flat buffer of data

Parameters:

value – The data

set_description(arg0: navground.core.BufferDescription, arg1: bool) → bool#

Sets the description.

If force is set, it will set the description and possibly reset the buffer if the type or size have changed. If force is not set, it won’t allow changing shape to a different size or type to a different type.

Parameters:

  • value – The value

  • force – Whenever data may be reset.

Returns:

Whether the description was set or not.

property categorical#
Type:

bool

Whether buffer is categorical.

property data#
Type:

numpy.ndarray

The data stored in the buffer

template parameter t:

the desired type

property description#
Type:

navground.core.BufferDescription

The description.

property high#
Type:

float

The upper bound.

property low#
Type:

float

The lower bound.

property shape#
Type:

tuple

The shape.

property size#
Type:

int

The buffer size

property type#
Type:

dtype

The buffer type

class SensingState#

Generic state to hold data from sensors in keyed buffers.

__init__() → None#

Construct an instance

get_buffer(key: str) → navground.core.Buffer#

Gets the buffer assigned to a key

Parameters:

key – The key

Returns:

The buffer.

init_buffer(*args, **kwargs)#

Overloaded function.

  1. init_buffer(key: str, description: navground.core.BufferDescription, value: Union[float, float, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int]) -> navground.core.Buffer

Initializes a buffer with a description and a uniform value.

Parameters:

  • key – The key

  • desc – The description of the buffer

  • value – The value to assign to the buffer

Returns:

The buffer if successfully initialized else a null pointer

  1. init_buffer(key: str, description: navground.core.BufferDescription) -> navground.core.Buffer

Initializes a buffer with description, with data set to zero.

Parameters:

  • key – The key

  • desc – The description of the buffer

Returns:

The buffer if successfully initialized else a null pointer

  1. init_buffer(key: str, data: Union[List[float], List[float], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int], List[int]]) -> navground.core.Buffer

Initializes a flat buffer with data.

Parameters:

  • key – The key

  • value – The data

Returns:

The buffer if successfully initialized else a null pointer

set_buffer(key: str, buffer: navground.core.Buffer) → None#

Assign a buffer to a key.

Parameters:

  • key – The new value

  • value – The value

property buffers#
Type:

navground.core.BufferMap

The buffers.
